p: In comparison, the 2002 SARS pandemic, which also originated in China, resulted in 8096 people infected and 774 deaths (9.6%). On the other hand, the 2012 MERS pandemic infected 2494 people causing 858 deaths (34.4%). Therefore, although MERS and SARS had higher mortality, the much larger number of people infected with SARS-CoV-2, and the rate at which the number is increasing, raises red epidemiologic flags.
